names.pinyin: chang pu yu jin tang jia wei

actions: Opens the Orifices, vaporizes Phlegm, removes filth, calms the Spirit, disperses Wind, transforms turbid Dampness, harmonizes the Middle Jiao, awakens the Spleen and promotes the movement of Qi.

With Yu Jin, transforms Dampness, opens the Orifices and awakens the brain to treat Warm-Damp febrile disease when Heat has entered the Pericardium or where turbid Dampness has blocked the clear Orifices with loss of consciousness or confusion, tinnitus and forgetfulness.
Activates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, regulates Qi flow, clears Heat, clears the Heart and Pericardium and opens the Orifices.
Clears Heat, resolves Dampness and activates the Blood.
With Mu Dan Pi, resolves Qi Level Stagnation leading to Heat.
Clears Heat, especially in the Upper Jiao, promotes urination and relieves toxicity.
Clears Heat, promotes urination and clears Damp-Heat.
Clears Heat, cools and harmonizes the Blood, Activates the Blood and dispels Blood Stasis.
Clears Heat and transforms Hot Phlegm.
With Lian Qiao, unblocks and drains Heat toxin.
Tonifies the Spleen, nourishes Stomach Yin, stops diarrhea, tonifies Kidney Yin and astringes Jing.
Clears the water passages of the San Jiao

symptoms: Fullness and distention in the abdomen
Aching, heaviness and stiffness in the limbs and back
A weary feeling in the whole body
